sense.name: a technical draft or drawing, as for architecture
sense.examples: The architect showed his clients the blueprints for their new house. John wondered whether the wiring schemes shown in the blueprint were up to code. Mary handed him the newest revisions of the blueprints for the office building.

sense.name: a guiding plan or model for something
sense.commentary: BLUEPRINT[+form][+plan][+guiding] Note: a figurative extension of sense 1
sense.examples: The senator does not see this strategy as a blueprint for victory in Iraq. The dictator seems to have a vague blueprint for land redistribution.
